mappedQuestions.reasoning: Question asks for the priority action when a student expresses suicidal thoughts (assess plan, intent, and means immediately).
Question describes a student's disruptive behavior occurring only during math worksheets to get sent out, asking to identify the function (Escape/Avoidance).
Question asks for the primary component of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) for anxiety (identifying and challenging cognitive distortions).
Question asks for the definition of the 'A-B-C' model in Functional Behavior Assessment (Antecedent-Behavior-Consequence).
Question asks for the essential characteristic of a replacement behavior in a BIP (it must serve the same function as the problem behavior).
Question asks how depression presentation in children often differs from adults (Irritability/Somatic complaints vs. Sadness).
Question asks for the diagnostic criteria for ADHD regarding setting (symptoms must be present in two or more settings).
Question asks to identify the therapy model that uses the 'Miracle Question' (Solution-Focused Brief Therapy).
Question asks for the most effective method to teach social skills (Modeling, Rehearsal, and Feedback/Role-play).
Question asks how to distinguish Non-Suicidal Self-Injury (NSSI) from suicidal intent (Assessment of intent to die).
Question asks which student profile is contraindicated for group counseling (e.g., severe conduct disorder/aggressive behavior).
Question asks to identify the behavioral principle where removing an aversive stimulus increases behavior (Negative Reinforcement).

suggestedNewSkills.name: Child & Adolescent Psychopathology
suggestedNewSkills.description: Identify diagnostic criteria and developmental presentations of common childhood disorders (ADHD, Depression, Anxiety, ASD, ODD).
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer requires knowledge of DSM-5 criteria or developmental variations (e.g., irritability in child depression).

suggestedNewSkills.name: Group Counseling Dynamics
suggestedNewSkills.description: Understand group formation, member selection (screening), and group stages (forming, storming, norming, performing).
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer identifies appropriate candidates for groups or recognizes group process stages.
